lines.line: Hello.
What ho, sirrah. Spiffing day for a walk in the park, what?
...spiffing?
Absolutely, top-hole! Well, can't stay and chat all day, dontchaknow! Ta-ta for now!
Erm... goodbye.
Hello Sir Amik.
Hello, friend!
Do you have any other quests for me to do?
Quests, eh? Well, I don't have anything on the go at the moment, but there is an organisation that is always looking for capable adventurers to assist them.
Your excellent work sorting out those Black Knights means I will happily write you a letter of recommendation.
Would you like me to put your name forwards to them?
Sure thing Sir Amik, sign me up!
Erm, well, this is a little embarrassing, I already HAVE put you forward as a potential member.
They are called the Temple Knights, and you are to meet Sir Tiffy Cashien in Falador park for testing immediately.
Okey dokey, I'll go do that then.
No thanks, that doesn't sound like the kind of thing that would interest me...
As you wish adventurer, let's say no more about it.
No, I am afraid not. I suggest you go meet Sir Tiffy in Falador Park, he will be expecting you.
Sir Amik Varze sent me to meet you here for some sort of testing...?
Ah! Amik told me all about you, dontchaknow! Spiffing job you did with the old Black Knights there, absolutely first class.
...thanks, I think.
Well, a top-notch fellow like yourself is just the right sort we've been seeking for our organisation.
...testing? What exactly do you mean by testing?
Jolly bad show! Varze was supposed to have informed you about all this before sending you here!
Well, not your fault I suppose, what? Anywho, our organisation is looking for a certain specific type of person to join.
So... You want me to go kill some monster or something for you?
Not at all, old bean. There's plenty of warriors around should we require dumb muscle.
That's really not the kind of thing our organisation is after, what?
So you want me to go and fetch you some kind of common item, and then take it for delivery somewhere on the other side of the country?
Because I really hate doing that!
Haw haw haw What a dull thing to ask of someone, what?
I know what you mean though, I did my fair share of running errands when I was a young adventurer, myself!
So what exactly will this test consist of?
Can't let just any old riff-raff in, what? The mindless thugs and bully boys are best left in the White Knights or the Guards, we look for the top-shelf brains to join us.
So you want to test my brains? Will it hurt?
Haw Haw Haw That's a good one!
Not in the slightest... Well, maybe a bit, but we all have to make sacrifices occasionally, what?
What do you want me to do then?
It's a test of wits, what? I'll take you to our secret training grounds, and you will have to pass through a series of five separate intelligence tests to prove you're our sort of
adventurer.
Standard puzzle room rules will apply.
Erm... what are 'standard puzzle room rules' exactly?
Never done this sort of thing before, what?
The simple rules are: No items or equipment to be brought with you. Each room is a self contained puzzle. You may quit at any time.
Of course, if you quit a room, then all your progress up to that point will be cleared, and you'll have to start again from scratch.
Our organisation manages to filter all the top-notch adventurers this way. So, are you ready to go?
This organisation you keep mentioning... Perhaps you could tell me a little about it?
Oh, that Amik! Jolly bad form, did he not tell you anything that he was supposed to?
No... He didn't really tell me anything except to come here and meet you...
Well now old sport, let me give you the heads up and the low down, what?
I represent the Temple Knights. We are the premier order of Knights in Asgarnia, if not the world. Saradomin himself personally founded our order
centuries ago, and we answer only to him.
Only the very best of the best are permitted to join, and the powers we command are formidable indeed.
You might say that we are the front line of defence for the entire kingdom!
So what's the difference between you and the White Knights?
Well, in simple terms, we're better! Any fool with a sword can manage to get into the White Knights, which is mostly the reason they are so very, very incompetent, what?
The Temple Knights on the other hand have to be smarter, stronger, better than all others. We are the elite. No man controls us for our orders come directly from
Saradomin himself!
Cool, you mean I get to meet Saradomin?
Well, uh, not exactly... Sir Vey Lance, our head of operations, is the only one of our order who has ever personally met Saradomin, but everything he tells us to do is done with
Saradomin's implicit permission.
It's not every job where you have more authority than the king, now is it?
Wait... You can order the King around?!?!
Well, not me personally, I'm only in the recruitment side of things dontchaknow, but the higher ranking members of the organisation have almost absolute power over this kingdom.
Plus a few others, so I hear....
Anyway, this is why we keep our organisation shrouded in secrecy, and why we demand such rigorous testing for all potential recruits. Speaking of which, are you ready to begin your
testing?
Yeah, this sounds right up my street. Let's go!
Well, bad luck old gal, you'll need to have a completely empty inventory and you can't be wearing any equipment before we can accurately test you.
Don't want people cheating by smuggling stuff in, what?
Come and see me again after you've been to the old bank to drop your stuff off, what?
Jolly good show! Now, the training grounds location is a secret so...
Here we go! Mind your head!
Oops, ignore the smell! Nearly there!
And... Here we are! Best of luck!
Well... I don't know... This doesn't really sound like my kind of thing...
To be honest, I'd rather go kill stuff for loot than use my mind to work things out...
Well, it takes all sorts to make the world spin, what? Maybe you'll find a nice job with the Guards sometime.
Sad though, your intelligence file seemed quite promising. Should you change your mind, you come back and let me know, what?
Oh, jolly bad luck, what? Not quite the brainbox you thought you were, eh?
Well, never mind! You have an open invitation to join our organisation, so when you're feeling a little smarter, come back and talk to me again!
Ah, what ho! Back for another go at the old testing, what?
Greetings friend, and welcome here, you'll find my puzzle not so clear. Hidden amongst my words, it's true, the password for the door as a clue.
Better than me, you'll not find In rhyming and in puzzles. This clue so clear will tax your mind Entirely as it confuzzles!
This riddle of mine may confuse, I am quite sure of that. Mayhap you should closely peruse Every word i have spat?
Feel the aching of your mind In puzzlement, confused. See the clue hidden behind His words, as you perused.
More than words, i have not for you Except the things i say today. Aware are you, this is a clue? Take note of what i say!
Look closely at the words i speak; And study closely every part. See for yourself the word you seek Trapped for you if you're smart.
Rare it is that you will see A puzzle such as this! In many ways it tickles me Now, watching you hit and miss!
I don't get that riddle...
Can I have a different one?
Before you hurry through that door Inspect the words i spoke. There is a simple hidden flaw Ere you think my rhyme a joke.
Twice it is now, i have stated In a rhyme, what is the pass. Maybe my words obfuscated Entirely beyond your class.
First my clue you did not see, I really wish you had. Such puzzling wordplay devilry Has left you kind of mad!
Many types have passed through here Even such as you amongst their sort. And in the end, the puzzles clear; The hidden word you saught.
Last time my puzzle did not help Apparently, so you've bidden. Study my speech carefully, whelp To find the answer, hidden.
Repetition, once again Against good sense it goes. In my words, the answers plain Now that you see rhyme flows.
Can I have the final clue for the door?
Betrayed by words the answer is In that what i say is the key There is no more help after this Especially no more from me.
Three times now, my riddle said; I hope you finally see the clue. Maybe think on what you've read; Easy when you know what to do.
For the last time i will state In simple words, the clue. Such tricky words make you irate Having no idea what to do...
Maybe i will do my best; Especially at giving clues. Attempt to help you pass the test! That should help me pay my dues.
Lo! my final speech is now Attended to by you. Study my words, and find out how To understand my clue!
Repeat myself to give the clue Again, i now do speak. It's hidden in my words - hey you! Now find the answer you seek.
Your wit is sharp, your brains quite clear; You solved my puzzle with no fear. At puzzles I rank you quite the best, now enter the portal for your next test.
It's sad to say, this test beat you. I'll send you to Tiffy, what to do?
Greetings. I am here to test your wits with a simple riddle.
Here is my riddle: I estimate there to be 1 million inhabitants in the world of Gielinor, creatures and people both.
What would be the number you would get if you multiply the number of fingers on everythings left hand, to the nearest million?
Here is my riddle: I have both a husband and daughter.
My husband is four times older than my daughter. In twenty years time, he will be twice as old as my daughter.
How old is my daughter now?
Here is my riddle: Which of the following statements is true?
Here is my riddle: Imagine that you have been captured by an enemy. You are to be killed, but in a moment of mercy, the enemy has allowed you to pick your own demise.
Your first choice is to be drowned in a lake of acid.
Your second choice is to be burned on a fire.
Your third choice is to be thrown to a pack of wolves that have not been fed in over a month.
Your final choice of fate is to be thrown from the walls of a castle, many hundreds of feet high.
Which fate would you be wise to choose?
Here is my riddle: I dropped four identical stones, into four identical buckets, each containing an identical amount of water.
The first bucket's water was at 32 degrees Fahrenheit, the second was at 33 degrees, the third at 34 and the fourth was at 35 degrees.
Which bucket's stone dropped to the bottom of the bucket last?
Excellent work. Please step through the portal to meet your next challenge.
No... I am very sorry. Apparently you are not up to the challenge. I will return you where you came from, better luck in the future.
Welcome. This room will test your observation skills.
Study the statues closely. There is one missing statue in this room.
We will also mix the order up a little to make things interesting for you!
You have 10 seconds to memorise the statues... starting NOW!
We will now dim the lights and bring the missing statue back in.
Please touch the statue you think has been added.
What am I supposed to be doing again?
Touch the statue that was brought in after you entered.
If you touch the wrong one, you will fail this task, and will be escorted back to Falador.
Excellent work. Please step through the portal to meet your next challenge.
No... I am very sorry. Apparently you are not up to the challenge. I will return you where you came from, better luck in the future.
Ah, you have arrived. Speak to me to begin your task.
Ah, welcome. I have but one clue for you to pass this room's puzzle: 'Patience'.
No... I am very sorry. Apparently you are not up to the challenge. I will return you where you came from, better luck in the future.
Excellent work. Please step through the portal to meet your next challenge.
Ah, you're finally here. Your task for this room is to defeat Sir Leye. He has been blessed by Saradomin to be undefeatable by any blade, so it should be quite a challenge for you.
If you are having problems, remember; A true warrior uses his wits as much as his brawn. Fight smarter, not harder.
No blade may defeat me!
AH-HA HA HA! You can NEVER defeat ME! I am blessed by Saradomin himself! NO BLADE MAY DEFEAT ME!
Excellent work. Please step through the portal to meet your next challenge.
Well done, that was your fourth test, you only have one more to go.
Please step through the portal to your final test... ...and good luck.
Excellent work! You have passed all five of the required tests! Please accept my congratulations!
Greetings. Welcome to my challenge.
All you need to do is leave from the opposite door to where you came in by.
I will warn you that this is more complicated than it may at first appear.
I should also warn you that there are limited supplies of the items in this room, so think carefully before using them, or you may find yourself stuck, and have to leave to start again!
Best of luck!
Can you give me any help?
No, I am sorry, but that is forbidden by our rules.
If you are having a particularly tough time of it, I suggest you leave and come back later when you are in a more receptive frame of mind.
Sometimes a break from concentration will yield fresh insight. Our aim is to test you, but not to the point of frustration!
Okay, thanks!
Please... I am REALLY stuck... Isn't there ANYTHING you can do to help me...?
Well... Look, I really shouldn't say anything about this room, but...
When I was attempting to join the Temple Knights I myself had to do this puzzle myself.
It was slightly different, but the idea behind it was the same, and I left the notes I had made while doing it hidden in one of the bookcases.
If you look carefully you may find them, and they may be of some use to you.
I really can't be any more help than that I'm afraid, it is more than my job's worth to have given you the help I already have.
Okay, thanks a lot, you've been very helpful!
Best of luck with the test, I hope your application is successful.
Ah, welcome.
Hello there. What am I supposed to be doing in this room?
Well, your task is to take this fox, this chicken and this bag of grain across that bridge there to the other side of the room.
When you have done that, your task is complete.
Is that it?
Well, it is not quite as simple as that may sound.
Firstly, you may only carry one of the objects across the room at a time, for the bridge is old and fragile.
Secondly, the fox wants to eat the chicken, and the chicken wants to eat the grain. Should you ever leave the fox unattended with the chicken, or the grain unattended with the chicken, then
one of them will be eaten, and you will be unable to complete the test.
Okay, I'll see what I can do.
Listen, this is really annoying me. Can't you just stop the fox eating the chicken or the chicken eating the grain for me, while I carry the other stuff across the bridge?
I am afraid not. My task is solely to observe your progress, we have explicit instructions not to assist you in any way..
No, but seriously, please? Think of the poor chicken and grain! Being eaten!
I am truly sorry, but my hands are tied. I suggest you think carefully before taking any items across the bridge with you, to ensure nothing gets eaten while you are not paying attention.
This is the only help I may give you...
Well, thanks I guess...
I really don't think I should be carrying more than 5 Kg across that rickety bridge...
No... I am very sorry. Apparently you are not up to the challenge. I will return you where you came from, better luck in the future.
I believe I've managed to pass the tests!
Oh, jolly well done! Your performance will need to be evaluated by Sir Vey personally, but I don't think it's going too far ahead of myself to welcome you to the team!

characters.name: Sir Tiffy Cashien
characters.description: Elderly male, exaggerated upper-class British accent, jovial and eccentric tone. Head of Temple Knights recruitment who speaks with stereotypical British vernacular like 'What ho!' and 'Dontchaknow!'

characters.name: Sir Amik Varze
characters.description: Middle-aged male, refined British accent, authoritative and diplomatic tone. Leader of the White Knights and regent of Asgarnia, speaks with measured professionalism befitting his military and political position.

characters.name: Sir Ren Itchood
characters.description: Middle-aged male, soft British accent, calm and poetic tone. A Temple Knight observer who speaks exclusively in rhymes and riddles, carries a lyre and has a serene, musical disposition.

characters.name: Ms. Hynn Terprett
characters.description: Middle-aged female, crisp British accent, formal and intellectual tone. A Temple Knight recruiter who administers logic puzzles with a clever, measured demeanor befitting an examiner.

characters.name: Lady Table
characters.description: Middle-aged female, proper British accent, formal and observant tone. A Temple Knight observer who tests memory and observation skills with clear, professional instructions.

characters.name: Sir Tinley
characters.description: Middle-aged male, calm British accent, serene and patient tone. A Temple Knight observer in white armour who values patience above all, speaking with quiet wisdom and certainty.

characters.name: Sir Kuam Ferentse
characters.description: Middle-aged male, authoritative British accent, encouraging and professional tone. A Temple Knight observer who oversees combat trials, offering cryptic hints while maintaining evaluative composure.

characters.name: Sir Leye
characters.description: Adult male, gruff British accent, arrogant and surly tone. A Temple Knight blessed by Saradomin who boasts about his invulnerability with confident, mocking laughter.

characters.name: Miss Cheevers
characters.description: Adult female, warm British accent, helpful and slightly mischievous tone. A Temple Knight observer who administers alchemy puzzles and secretly offers hints despite the rules.

characters.name: Sir Spishyus
characters.description: Middle-aged male, formal British accent, apologetic and strict tone. A Temple Knight observer who administers logic puzzles and regretfully enforces rules without offering assistance.
